thread.title: Orlando Police Department mourns loss of officer to heart condition
thread.title_full: Orlando Police Department mourns loss of officer to heart condition - Orlando Sentinel

author: orlandosentinel.com
title: Orlando Police Department mourns loss of officer to heart condition
text:
An 18-year veteran of the Orlando Police Department died Saturday after battling heart problems, the Orlando Police Department announced.
Ofc. Kenneth Brown, 45, was “loved by many,” the department said in a tweet thanking him for his dedication and service.
Ofc. Brown was assigned to the Orlando International Airport immediately before his death, but had spent most of his career in the motor unit, department spokeswoman Wanda Miglio.
This is the second loss of an officer for the Orlando Police Department this year. Lt. Debra Clayton was killed in the line of duty in January during the hunt for accused killer Markeith Loyd.
This is a breaking news story. Check back for updates.
miwilliams@orlandosentinel.com
 Markeith Loyd
